net.kemuri9.invoke

Interface InvokeField

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Member
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InvokeFieldInstance<C,T>, InvokeFieldStatic<T>

    public interface InvokeField
extends Member
    Represents a Field and its access through the Invocation engine

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface java.lang.reflect.Member

        DECLARED, PUBLIC

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Retrieve the Field represented by this InvokeField

    • Method Detail

      • asInstance

        <C,F> InvokeFieldInstance<C,F> asInstance()
        Retrieve the Field as a InvokeFieldInstance
        Type Parameters:
        C - Type of Class
        F - Type of Field data
        Returns:
        InvokeFieldInstance representing this InvokeField
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When not an instance field

      • asStatic

        <F> InvokeFieldStatic<F> asStatic()
        Retrieve the Field as a InvokeFieldStatic
        Type Parameters:
        F - Type of Field data
        Returns:
        InvokeFieldStatic representing this InvokeField
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - When not a static field

      • getField

        Field getField(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup)
        throws IllegalAccessException
        Retrieve the Field represented by this InvokeField
        Parameters:
        lookup - MethodHandles.Lookup to access the field with. null indicates to use the default lookup
        Returns:
        Field represented by this InvokeField
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - When lookup does not have access to the field

      • getGetterHandle

        MethodHandle getGetterHandle()
        Retrieve the MethodHandle that performs the get operation
        Returns:
        MethodHandle to perform the get operation

      • getSetterHandle

        MethodHandle getSetterHandle()
        Retrieve the MethodHandle that performs the set operation
        Returns:
        MethodHandle to perform the set operation. May be null if the field is final and the utilized Lookup did not have access to the setter.

      • getType

        MethodType getType()
        Retrieve the type of Field
        Returns:
        type of field
